comments.body: I guess it is better to specify this through the build system and maybe a `-D__ROOFIT_VTAG=...` compiler option.

I'm not sure that's necessary. This tag didn't change since 2011, and I don't see that it's happening soon. I didn't want to interfere with the work of the original authors, though, so I left it in place.
I think it's a good practice to separate these constants from the code; however, given that it has been inherited from the original authors, we can leave it in place and fix it later if need be.
I think that GCC automatically runs CPU detection code, i.e. `__builtin_cpu_init()`, in a constructor, so this should work out-of-the-box.  Please, confirm that I am not wrong.  :-)
It does work out-of-the-box on modern-enough gcc and clang.
